qas.question: Which BYU building is one of the most attended art museus in the Mountain West?
How many photographs are in BYU's Museum of Peoples and Cultures?
Who found many of the fossils displayed in BYU's Museum of Paleontology?
From which period does BYU Museum of Paleontology hold many artifacts from?
How many visitors does BYU Museum of Paleontology receive each year?
What is home to more than 50,000 artifacts?

plausible_answers.text: Monte L. Bean Life Science Museum

qas.question: What did Dr. James A. Bean find many of?

context: The campus is home to several museums containing exhibits from many different fields of study. <b5_0><b6_0>BYU's <a0_0>Museum of Art<b6_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/>, for example, is one of the largest and most attended art museums in the Mountain West. This Museum aids in academic pursuits of students at BYU via research and study of the artworks in its collection. The Museum is also open to the general public and provides educational programming. The Museum of Peoples and Cultures is a museum of archaeology and ethnology. It focuses on native cultures and artifacts of the Great Basin, American Southwest, Mesoamerica, Peru, and Polynesia. Home to more than 40,000 artifacts and <a1_0>50,000<a1_0/> photographs, it documents BYU's archaeological research. The <b7_0>BYU Museum of Paleontology<b7_0/> was built in 1976 to display the many fossils found by <a2_0>BYU's Dr. James A. Jensen<a2_0/>. It holds many artifacts from the <a3_0>Jurassic Period (210-140 million years ago)<a3_0/>, and is one of the top five collections in the world of <b9_0>fossils<b9_0/> from that time period. It has been featured in magazines, newspapers, and on television internationally. The museum receives <a4_0>about 25,000<a4_0/> visitors every year. The <b8_0>Monte L. Bean Life Science Museum<b8_0/> was formed in 1978. It features several forms of plant and animal life on display and available for research by students and scholars.
